description.narrative: 1. Employment: The project is expected to employ over 5,000 workers during construction, and following the start of operations, is expected to employ around 1,000 employees in the pulp mill and forestry operations. Along with Klabin''s existing paper mill in nearby Monte Alegre, the project will be the largest employer in this part of the state. 2. Taxes: The project is expected to pay over US$50MM annually in taxes, once it reaches steady state. Under a scheme that was developed through Klabin''s initiative, in conjunction with local governments, the tax receipts will be shared with the neighboring municipalities, all of which are among the poorest municipalities in Parana. 3. Carbon Sequestration: The project will include a forestry base of 106,500 ha, which will be under FSC certification. 4. Renewable Energy: The project includes a biomass-based co-generation plant with a capacity of 260MW. 5. Import Substitution: The project will be the first fluff producer in Brazil, and one of the few softwood producers in the country. By replacing imports that currently meet demand for these products, the Project will enable domestic proeduction in these segments in Brazil.

The project consists of the development of a 1.5 million ton per annum (mtpa) greenfield pulp production facility, with associated forest plantations, infrastructure and logistics, near Ortigueira, Brazil. The plant will produce a mix of hardwood and softwood pulp, which will serve the domestic and export markets.
